intro: Ornithogalum baeticum subsp. atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic star-of-Bethlehem, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in open, sunny habitats. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate with dry summers and wet winters. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
